content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

user_context_message_data.about_model_message:
don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.

Microsoft Teams live translated captions supported languages 2025
KUDO AI interpreting platform government meetings

metadata.reasoning_title: Searching for language interpretation and live captions options

entries.title: Enabling and configuring translated captions - Zoom
entries.snippet: Zoom translated captions enable users to have the speech in a meeting or webinar automatically translated in real-time to captions in another language. For example, if a meeting participant is speaking in English, other participants can view captions in German, Italian, Japanese, and more.

metadata.reasoning_title: Searching for language interpretation and live captions options

entries.title: Multilingual speech recognition in Microsoft Teams
entries.snippet: The Interpreter agent Multilingual speech recognition Live translated captions and transcripts Translated recap after multilingual meetings Supported languages English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean. Interpreter agent Note: Interpreter agent is available as part of the Microsoft 365 Copilot license.

entries.title: Use live captions in Microsoft Teams meetings - Microsoft Support
entries.snippet: Notes: Live translated captions in meetings are available as part of Teams Premium and Microsoft 365 Copilot, an add-on license that provides additional features to make Teams meetings more personalized, intelligent, and secure. To get access to an eligible license, contact your IT admin. If the meeting organizer has a Teams Premium or Microsoft 365 Copilot license, all meeting participants ...

entries.title: Show real-time translation and transcription in meetings and webinars
entries.snippet: Real-time translation and transcription allows you to have more inclusive and engaging meetings and webinars. The host can select from 15 spoken languages for a meeting or webinar, which can then be translated into more than 100 other languages in closed captions. This article is about Webex meetings and webinars.

entries.title: KUDO | Live Speech Translation & Captions in 200 Languages
entries.snippet: The #1 solution for human and AI-powered live speech translation on any platform—remote, hybrid, or in-person. Get our platform or app.

entries.title: KUDO Launches AI Assist: Revolutionary Real-Time Support for Interpreters
entries.snippet: AI Assist represents a major leap forward in interpreter support technology, delivering live captions of the speaker’s language to help interpreters maintain precision, confidence, and cognitive endurance during even the most complex meetings.

entries.title: 2025 Guide to Zoom Real-time Translation | Deeptrue Blog
entries.snippet: Learn how to use Zoom’s real-time translated captions and explore its new AI voice translation feature coming in 2025. For smoother multilingual meetings, Deeptrue offers live voice translation and a free 60-minute trial across all major platforms.

entries.title: Live Translation Options for MS Teams in 2025: Interpretation and AI ...
entries.snippet: Currently, Microsoft Teams supports translated captions in over 50 languages, including major European, Asian, and Middle Eastern languages. The translation works from the spoken language into the selected caption language, depending on what's supported by your Microsoft 365 setup.

entries.title: Live Translation Options for Zoom: Interpretation and AI Captions
entries.snippet: Language interpretation, multi-language captions, or translated captions - learn how you can remove language barriers from your Zoom meetings.

entries.title: Translation option for closed captions on Webex
entries.snippet: So I'm correct if I understand that real-time translation and automated closed captions are two different things? Also, 4 languages are included for free, but I can have the captions only in English or I have also the other languages available? How can they be considered free if I have to pay for the translation add-on?

entries.title: KUDO Launches Groundbreaking AI Assist for Interpreters ... - PRWeb
entries.snippet: NEW YORK, May 13, 2025 /PRNewswire-PRWeb/ -- KUDO, the world's leader in multilingual meetings solutions powered by professional interpreters and AI, today announced the release of AI Assist; a first-of-its-kind feature offering real-time speech transcription to interpreters directly within the KUDO interpreter console.

entries.title: How to i set up translation caption in a live teams meeting
entries.snippet: Ensure that the Live captions setting is set to Not enabled, but users can enable. Select Languages: During the meeting, the organizer can preselect up to 10 languages for attendees to use for live translated captions. If you want the captions to appear in French, ensure that French is selected as one of the languages.

entries.title: Real-Time Translations, Improved Search Performance and More in the ...
entries.snippet: In late March, Webex will begin a trial of real-time translation* – from English to 100+ languages. That means, non-native English speakers and/or hearing-impaired participants can choose closed captioning translation from English to one of the 108 additional languages supported.

entries.title: Interprefy for Zoom: Add Live Interpretation, AI Audio Translation ...
entries.snippet: Discover how Interprefy integrates with Zoom to deliver real-time AI Speech Translation and AI-powered live captions—enhancing accessibility and understanding for every participant.

entries.title: Understanding Microsoft Teams Language Translation Capabilities in ...
entries.snippet: Understanding Microsoft Teams Language Translation Capabilities in Meetings 4. November 2025 I sometimes get asked about the differences between Live Translated Captions and Transcripts and the newer Multilingual Speech Recognition feature in Teams, which Microsoft introduced back in April. And now, there’s also an Interpreter Agent.

entries.title: Webex Translation - jotme.io
entries.snippet: Transalte Webex meetings in real-time with caption Struggling with language barriers during meetings can be frustrating. Even worse, using standard line-by-line translation often leads to low-quality results that miss the context and nuances.

entries.snippet: KUDO, the world's leader in multilingual meetings solutions powered by professional interpreters and AI, today announced the release of AI Assist; a first-of-its-kind feature offering real-time ...

entries.title: Zoom Brings AI Live Speech Translation in-House - Slator
entries.snippet: Until now, Zoom’s multilingual toolkit revolved around two options: AI live translated captions — real-time text translation of spoken language into captions in up to 46 languages — and language interpretation, where human interpreters are assigned to parallel audio channels.
